CY/2020/0009/SL-Version 1-SYNOPTIC VIEW OF CYCLONE “BUREVI” IMPACT IN THE NORTHERN SRI LANKA-Satelite Imagery: 05 Dec 2020 | Published: 05 Dec 2020-Maresankooda-Aralaitivu-North-CSA RADARSAT-05 Dec 2020-: ;-Burevi, the second cyclone in the southern Bay of Bengal in a week, slammed into north/eastern Sri Lanka just before midnight (18:30 GMT) on Wednesday. Synoptic view of cyclone-affected areas in the northern part of Sri Lanka taken on 5th December 2020 from the “RADARSAT Constellation Mission (RCM / 3) supported by Canadian Space Agency. More than-five districts Jaffna, Kilinochchi, mullaitivu, manar and Vavuniya were affected by Cyclone as per local officials. Approximate inundated area in Jaffna district is 160 sq.km and 103-sq.km in Kilinochchi were severely affected with flooding and infrastructure damages. As per Disaster Management Centre (05 Dec 2020 18:00hrs) a total of 72,994 population-affected in the northern provinces, of which 57,530 population affected in Jaffna alone and in terms of house damages partially damaged were 2,951 and 65 houses are fully-damaged. ) @-International Water Management Institute (IWMI), Colombo, Sri Lanka; T:+94/11/2880000; Contact: wrd@iwmi.org; www.iwmi.cgiar.org- -

As a result, wind speed of 80/100 km per hour caused significant-disturbances. According to the Disaster Management center (DMC), as at 12.00 noon on December 3, 2020, 44,848 persons belonging to 13,366 families had been affected. Accordingly, the worst affected district-was Mannar (2,236 families, 7,749 persons).- - - - - -Affected families and peoples-Affected families and peoples- -Affected families and peoples- - - - - - -But by 6.00 pm on December 3, the number of affected families in Jaffna, Mannar, Kilinochchi, Mullaitivu, Vavuniya and Trincomalee districts was 12,932 and the number of individuals was about 43,979. The highest-number was from Jaffna district with 9,346 families and 31,703 peoples.In the above districts, the number of affected families rose to 20,796 and the number of individuals to 68,895, according to a report released at-6.00 pm on December 3 by DMC. ID: 744 Product N.: OINUKUALOFA, v1-Nuku Alofa / TONGA-Volcanic activity / Situation as of 18/01/2022-Grading / Detail map 05-eval-ee aes-OCEAN-SOUTH-ae oar 5-ole)-5 a eli)-7662500-Cartographic Information-Full color A1, 200 dpi resolution-0.2 oR) |-ici)-Grid: WGS 1984 UTM Zone 1S map coordinate system-Tick marks: WGS 84 geographical coordinate system-Legend-rita)-Built Up Grading Transportation Grading General Information-‘om |-Possibly damaged Road, Damaged JArea mrs-a-Road, Possibly damaged ae oc-ere MaceC MRIS ACRE Et Mea CCI LU S3-Local Road, No visible damage Sa-Cart Track, No visible damage-VeTem kelaureiela-After the eruption of the underwater volcano Hunga/Tonga/Hunga/Ha'apai located 65km-north of Tonga, a tsunami was triggered and affected several islands in the region. The sky-was filled with black ash clouds. Damage following the tsunami has been reported from the-capital of Tonga, in other areas the damage assessment is ongoing.-The present map shows tsunami damage grade assessment, caused by the volcanic-eruption, in the area of Nuku Alofa (Tonga). The thematic layer has been derived from post/-event satellite image by means of visual interpretation. The land surface framed in the map-extent is completely covered with ash deposits as represented in the Overview map 01. The-a é ash deposit cover has been removed from the Detail map extent in order to increase the map-Tongatapu KK ; SESE . visibility of the damaged assets. The sky-was filled with black ash clouds. Damage following the tsunami has been reported from the-capital of Tonga, in other areas the damage assessment is ongoing.-The present map shows tsunami damage grade assessment, caused by the volcanic-eruption, in the area of Nuku Alofa (Tonga). The thematic layer has been derived from post/-event satellite image by means of visual interpretation. The land surface framed in the map-extent is completely covered with ash deposits as represented in the Overview map 01. The-ash deposit cover has been removed from the Detail map extent in order to increase the map-visibility of the damaged assets. 584-landslide-in-india-activation-_2.jpg: -13°0'0"N-12°30'0"N-Paseo)-Location of landslides triggered by the rainfall in August 2018-in parts of Dakshina Kannada and Kodagu districts, Karnataka-Based on the analysis of Post Event multitemporal high resolution satellite data-     -Landslide no. 31-Resourcesat/2 FMx-(03 Mager’)-amvarpe-Landslide no. 20-SPOT'6:(04/Sept 2018) Wikpesourcesat/2 FMx (03'March 2018-Resourcesat/2 FMx (03 March 2018)-reomea= ries tte 76°0'O'E-Note: When publishing this map as part of any report, source may be indicated as "Location of landslides triggered by the rainfall in August 2018-in parts of Dakshina Kannada and Kodagu districts, Karnataka" dated 04.09.2018 DSC/NDEM Map no: 2018/03, NRSC/ISRO, Hyderabad- -For official use-DISASTER EVENT ID: 06/LS/2018/Karnataka-MAP ID: 2018/03-Date of Issue :04.09.2018-Location Map-MAHARASHTRA-Pear]-Le Tire ter)-District L-Kodagu-District-\-The red box shows the extent of Pleiades data. Most part of the image is cloudy.-  -About the Event-Landslides were triggered in the Kodagu and Dakshina Kannada-districts of Karnataka due to heavy rain in the 3rd week of August,-2018. Some people were killed and several others are missing-due to this event. Several roads have been blocked due to the-landslides. The hill slopes in this area have thick soil cover, which-makes it prone to landslide after heavy rainfall. It appears that the-landslides are mainly debris slides and debris flows.-Satellite Observations-Post event satellite images such as Pleiades (0.5 m),-Kompsat (4 m) were analysed in parts of Dakshina-Kannada District of Karnataka. Charter Activation Call/ld:764-As per media reports the Gandak river breached Saran embankment at two places in Gopalganj district of Bihar on Friday, affecting at least-50,000 people of 45 villages. The temporal Sentinel/1 SAR images shows that due to heavy rains in upper catchment areas and release of water-from upstream barrages the Gandak River to be in spate from July 16, 2020 onwards and which finally the embankment got breached on July 24,-2020. The flood waters (dark tone) entering low lying regions adjoining the Devapur and Barauli settlements are visible from the satellite image-of July 25, 2020.-Prepared By: Disaster Management Sciences Department, Indian Institute of Remote Sensing (IIRS), ISRO, Dehradun/248001, Uttarakhand www.iirs.gov.in- -
